title: How to Make Sloe Gin

steps.headline: Clean the sloes.
steps.description: Wash them thoroughly. After washing, pierce each one with a small sharp implement such as a clean needle or knife point. This will help to release their flavour.

steps.headline: If you're not using the bottle that the gin came in, use a sterilized one.
steps.description: Make sure it is thoroughly clean, then pour in the gin. Otherwise, use the original gin bottle.

steps.headline: Add the sloes to the gin.
steps.description: Also add the sugar and almond essence.

steps.headline: Attach the lid or stopper and shake well to distribute the ingredients.
Set aside to infuse.
steps.description: Give the bottle a gentle shake or swill every day to redistribute the contents evenly and help the sugar to dissolve.

steps.headline: Check the taste of the gin after 6 weeks.
steps.description: If it doesn't seem sweet enough, add some more sugar.

steps.headline: Continue to infuse until about 8-12 weeks.
steps.description: At this point, the sloe gin is ready to enjoy. You can leave the sloes in or strain them if wished.

text: Clean the sloes. Wash them thoroughly. After washing, pierce each one with a small sharp implement such as a clean needle or knife point. This will help to release their flavour. If you're not using the bottle that the gin came in, use a sterilized one. Make sure it is thoroughly clean, then pour in the gin. Otherwise, use the original gin bottle. Add the sloes to the gin. Also add the sugar and almond essence. Attach the lid or stopper and shake well to distribute the ingredients.  Set aside to infuse. Give the bottle a gentle shake or swill every day to redistribute the contents evenly and help the sugar to dissolve. Check the taste of the gin after 6 weeks. If it doesn't seem sweet enough, add some more sugar. Continue to infuse until about 8-12 weeks. At this point, the sloe gin is ready to enjoy. You can leave the sloes in or strain them if wished.
